The '''Redwater Health Centre''' is a 21-bed facility, 14-bed [[acute care]] including 1 [[palliative care]] bed and 7 [[long term care]] bed facility located in Redwater, 65 kilometers northeast of [[Edmonton|The City Edmonton]].<ref>[http://www.capitalhealth.ca/HospitalsandHealthFacilities/Hospitals/RedwaterHealthCentre/default.htm Redwater Health Centre]</ref> The health centre offers many of the main services to the community of Redwater including public health, rehabilitation, mental health, and environmental health services. The health center opened six long-term beds in 2006 due to the increasing amount of wait times in the [[Fort Saskatchewan, Alberta|Fort Saskatchewan]] health facility. All of the six beds were taken up within days of their opening.
The Redwater facility is known for recruiting [[physicians]] from around the world, most recently from [[South Africa]].<ref>[http://www.capitalhealth.ca/NewsAndEvents/Features/2006/Rural_Albertans_access_superior_health_services.htm Rural Albertans access superior health services]</ref>
==History== The facility first opened on January 1, 1973, to serve Redwater and its surrounding communities. The [[health center]] employs 95 [[full-time]], [[part-time]], and casual staff.<ref>[http://www.town.redwater.ab.ca/admin/contentx/default.cfm?PageId=8469&hdrmenu=0 "Health Centre"] Town of Redwater. Retrieved 6 February 2009.</ref>
==Future plans== [[Sarja Master Builder Inc.]] is a construction company that has undertaken a project to build a Medi-Clinic in Terragold Square, next to the hospital that will be affiliated with it. This will be Redwater's first power centre. The Medi-Clinic project is a two-story [[commercial building]], it will house the medical professionals of Redwater and surrounding areas. The construction is set to begin within the next months.<ref>[http://terragoldworld.com/current-construction-projects.html "CURRENT CONSTRUCTION PROJECTS"] Terragold Group. Retrieved 6 February 2009.</ref>
==Services==
The Redwater Health Centre offers many services.<ref>[http://www.capitalhealth.ca/HospitalsandHealthFacilities/Hospitals/RedwaterHealthCentre/default.htm Programs & Services]</ref>
===Palliative care=== The hospital has specially designed programs for people who are in the final stages of an [[Terminal illness|incurable illness]]. Their goal is not to cure the illness, but to make the last stages of life as comfortable as possible.<ref name="Information Sheet">[http://www.town.redwater.ab.ca/admin/contentx/default.cfm?PageId=8469&hdrmenu=0 Information Sheet]</ref>
===Continuing Care Program=== On March 7, 2006, six continuing care beds were opened in the hospital. The project was funded through the [[Health Sustainability Initiative]] (HSI), and [[Government of Alberta|government]] funding. More beds were opened on June 16, 2008.<ref name="Information Sheet"/>
===Nutritional Counseling=== A [[dietitian]] is able to provide [[Nutritionist|nutritional counseling]] for patients, outpatients, and people on [[home care]].<ref name="Information Sheet"/>
===Mental health services=== [[Mental Health]] therapists are able to provide help one day a week at Redwater. Either through physician or self-referral. They specialize in crisis intervention ([[Assessment of suicide risk|suicide risk]] assessments, and urgent assessments). And offer counseling for those who suffer from [[Clinical depression|depression]], [[bipolar]], and [[schizophrenia]].<ref name="Information Sheet"/>
===Optometrist services=== The fist [[optometrist]] office opened in Redwater in February, 1996. They provide total optometry services to the residents of Redwater, and surrounding communities.<ref name="Information Sheet"/>
===PARTY program=== The Redwater and District [[PARTY Program (Prevent Alcohol and Risk Related Trauma in Youth)]] provides programming for alcohol-related trauma, etc.<ref name="Information Sheet"/>
===Other services=== Other services include:<ref name="Information Sheet"/> *Telehealth *Clinical/Student Placements *Redwater Home Care *Community [[Physical medicine and rehabilitation|Rehabilitation]] Services *Community Health Services: Health Unit Staff *Health Unit Nursing *[[Dental Health]] Services *[[Audiology]] *[[Environmental Health]] Services *Redwater Health Centre Auxiliary
